text: The 2014–15 Eredivisie was the 59th Eredivisie tournament. PSV Eindhoven won the tournament, ending AFC Ajax's winning streak that was going since 2011. == Table == Team Moves on to 1 PSV Eindhoven (C) 34 29 1 4 92 31 +61 88 UEFA Champions League group stage 2 AFC Ajax 34 21 8 5 69 29 +40 71 UEFA Champions League third qualifying round 3 AZ 34 19 5 10 63 56 +7 62 UEFA Europa League third qualifying round 4 Feyenoord 34 17 8 9 56 39 +17 59 European competition play-offs 5 Vitesse 34 16 10 8 66 43 +23 58 European competition play-offs 6 PEC Zwolle 34 16 5 13 59 43 +16 53 European competition play-offs 7 Heerenveen 34 13 11 10 53 46 +7 50 European competition play-offs 8 Groningen 34 11 13 10 49 53 –4 46 UEFA Europa League group stage 9 Willem II 34 13 7 14 46 50 –4 46 10 Twente 34 13 10 11 56 51 +5 43 11 Utrecht 34 11 8 15 60 62 –2 41 12 Cambuur 34 11 8 15 46 56 –10 41 13 ADO Den Haag 34 9 10 15 44 53 –9 37 14 Heracles 34 11 4 19 47 64 –17 37 15 Excelsior 34 6 14 14 47 63 –16 32 16 NAC Breda (R) 34 6 10 18 36 68 –32 28 Relegation play-offs 17 Go Ahead Eagles (R) 34 7 6 21 29 59 –30 27 EL qualifying round and Relegation play-offs 18 Dordrecht (R) 34 4 8 22 24 76 –52 20 Eerste Divisie == Play-offs == === European competition play-offs === | Semi-finals | | Final ---|---|---|--- | | | | | | | | | | | | | | Heerenveen | 1 | 2 | 3 | | Feyenoord | 0 | 2 | 2 | | Heerenveen | 2 | 2 | 4 | | | Vitesse | 2 | 5 | 7 | PEC Zwolle | 1 | 1 | 2 | | Vitesse | 2 | 1 | 3 | Because Vitesse won the play-offs, they then qualified for the 2015–16 UEFA Europa League third qualifying round. === Relegation play-offs === Two teams from the 2014–15 Eredivisie and eight from the 2014–15 Eerste Divisie participated in these play-offs. In the end, De Graafschap and Roda JC Kerkrade won the play-offs, meaning that they move on to the 2015–16 Eredivisie, the two teams from the Eredivisie are relegated, and the six other teams remain in the Eerste Divisie. == References == Category:2014 in association football Category:2015 in association football Category:Football in the Netherlands Category:2014 in Europe Category:2015 in Europe Category:2010s in Dutch sport
title: 2014–15 Eredivisie
